private_information: I operate on and observe lower stacks and table placements primarily involving blocks A, B, D, E, F and their immediate relations.
I see that A is on the table and B is on A.
I see that D is on E and E is on the table.
I see that F is on the table and G is on F.
table_agent.goal: Report a concise structured observation of the initial positions and note which actions in the sequence affect the blocks you observe.

private_information: I operate on and observe upper tower relations primarily involving blocks C, H, G and interactions with other blocks.
I see that C is on H, H is on G, and G is on F.
I will note which actions in the sequence affect the blocks I observe.
tower_agent.goal: Report a concise structured observation of the initial positions and note which actions in the sequence affect the blocks you observe.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' observations and the provided action sequence, and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem file modeling the Blocks World instance and the final arrangement after applying the actions. The PDDL output must be suitable for the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: Blocks World rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Initial arrangement: A is on the table, B is on A, C is on H, D is on E, E is on the table, F is on the table, G is on F, H is on G.
Actions executed in order: unstack(D,E) then stack(D,C) then unstack(D,C) then stack(D,B) then unstack(D,B) then stack(D,C) then unstack(D,C) then stack(D,B) then unstack(C,H) then stack(C,D).

observe.system_prompt: You are an agent observing part of a Blocks World instance. Produce a concise structured observation of which blocks are on the table and which blocks are stacked on them among your subset, and list which of the provided actions affect those blocks.
observe.prompt: Your name is table_agent. You have access to the public information {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->table_agent->private_information}. Provide a concise structured observation describing positions for A B D E F G as you see them and indicate which actions from the sequence apply to those blocks. Do not output PDDL.

observe.system_prompt: You are an agent observing part of a Blocks World instance. Produce a concise structured observation of tower relations among your subset and list which of the provided actions affect those blocks.
observe.prompt: Your name is tower_agent. You have access to the public information {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->tower_agent->private_information}. Provide a concise structured observation describing positions for C H G and how they relate to other blocks, and indicate which actions from the sequence apply to those blocks. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent Blocks World modeling and PDDL authoring. Integrate the agents' structured observations and the public action sequence. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that model the standard Blocks World constraints (only top blocks movable and only one block carried) and that encode the initial state and a goal state corresponding to the final arrangement after applying the action sequence. The PDDL output must be suitable for the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Combine the following information to build a single consistent Blocks World PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting FastDownwards. Inputs: public info {environment->public_information}, observation from table_agent {obs_table_agent}, observation from tower_agent {obs_tower_agent}. Integrate and resolve any naming differences, keep action schemas consistent, represent the initial state exactly, and express the final arrangement (after applying the action sequence) as the goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> tags.
